name: BEST WESTERN Gold Country Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this Best Western for three nights recently. It is an older place but with nice grounds. However the pool and hot tub were out of commission and we felt this should have been mentioned on their website as it is hot there this month.
reviews.title: Needs improved staff training

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: We were given a room that backed up to the freeway though with windows closed noise was not a problem. However it always smelled musty though it was clean and reasonably attractive. They serve a decent but simple expanded continental breakfast and have hot fresh baked cookies in the lobby each afternoon. A nice touch. It is right off the freeway convenient to Grass Valley and Nevada City. Our negative experience involved the housekeeper. We returned to our room after the complementary breakfast and found the housekeeper making up the bed. We said we would be out in just a few minutes. She continued to finish the bed and went to clean the sink area. My husband said he wanted to brush his teeth and she just stepped aside to let him in to do that. The toilet area is separate from the sink area and he then said he needed to use the rest room. She just continued to clean the sink area while visiting with me. He went in and closed the door though she was just on the other side. She was very friendly, but very inappropriate. It is hard to imagine they don't make it clear that if the people using the room are in it they deserve privacy. If not it is just common sense. We should have asked her to leave but we were leaving in a moment and let it go. She seemed to be a nice person. Otherwise, for the price this is a better than average motel with some nice amenities and nice grounds when the pool and spa are fixed. I think it is a better than average motel for the area but needs to pay attention to staff training.
reviews.title: Don't stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worst hotel room I have ever been in. Stinky, dingy room. Supposedly I had a non smoking room but the room smelled like smoke. When I call the front desk and told staff, they said it was a non smoking room and offered to come spray the room????
reviews.title: Outdated and Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was really small and over-crowded with outdated furnishings. This place is an older hotel, needs some TLC. Right next to the police station, so I felt safe. Front desk personnel weren't very friendly. If you're a pet lover, this is the place for you. I saw a lot of dogs staying at this hotel with their owners. The location is good and within walking distance to other restaurants and convenience stores. The room was clean, and the bed was comfortable enough for one night. Stayed upstairs and had to go up and down the stairs, no elevators. Didn't try the free breakfast, but there is a nice breakfast place across the street which I'd highly recommend if you decide to stay. The hotel to me was over-priced for what you get. Beware I left a few items in the room because was in a big hurry to check-out, called a day later to see if housekeeping could put my things aside or send them to me. Unfortunately, I had to call 3 times and left messages, on the 4th try someone actually stayed on the line with me and helped me, but only to tell me that housekeeping didn't see my $80 blouse and phone charger. Oh well, it looks like I'll never see those things again. Don't leave anything behind, you'll never get them back!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Clean, reasonably priced, comfy. Decent continental breakfast although the breakfast room is small.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night in off season for $71 in a large king bed room with a sofa. It is easily accessible from the freeway, but there are no tourist site in walking distance. The charming old town centers of Grass Valley and Nevada City are near by car.
reviews.title: Excellent value, courteous and friendly service, good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have an excellently equipped fitness center and a good breakfast with hot food. The day we were there it was french toast with sausage and/or bacon. There were also the usual hot/cold cereals, breads, fruit, yogurt, boiled eggs, etc. They were kept well-stocked.
reviews.title: Clean, Affordable, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception staff were very pleasant, helpful and friendly, offering us warm cookies any time we wanted them in the afternoon or evening. We will return.
reviews.title: Traveling back to the 80s - it was clean and that was it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights for a local event. Rooms were clean, quiet and affordable. In a tourist town where rooms during tourist season or a local event such as a Scottish Festival go for $160-$225/night +10% tax, rooms at this hotel are typically $90-120. Location is near shops and not far from the the downtown areas of Grass Valley and nearby more historic Nevada City. Breakfast 6-10am is good but not spectacular. Complimentary local newspaper, coffee/tea all day. Staff is helpful and efficiently made an adjustment to our reservation that actually saved us money. Good access to and from local freeway.
reviews.title: Large rooms, comfortable, quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice area that northern part of the "Gold Country" around Nevada City and what an outdated motel from the inside, because what appears neat on the outside is a turn-around once you will enter your room.
reviews.title: 14 Karart stay at Gold Country Best Western !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: besides the bed that was too soft for me, and the color of the bathroom, everything was just right!
reviews.title: Nothing fancy, but has everything you need

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Great value
reviews.title: A Wonderful Hotel!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a death in the family, and I had to fly out to California to take care of the arrangements to bring my cousin back to TN. I was referred to stay at the Best Western Gold Inn. It was in a good location, the staff was "Great!!!" They were very hospitable, and helpful with all my needs. The rooms were like double cottages, very clean and smelled so fresh. The king size bed and pillows and soft and I slept so good. The free breakfast was wonderful, and they constantly kept bringing out fresh, hot food. Check and checking out was very thorough, they even gave me directions to Lake Tahoe. If you like the mountains, this is a beautiful place to visit. I am planning on taking my wife there for a few days, and we will stay there.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, dirty pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just as I read here on tripadvisor, this is a nice, comfortable hotel, and a very good value for the money. Although the hotel is at a confluence of a highway and a major road, it was set back just enough not to be noisy.
reviews.title: OK hotel, strict check-in/check-out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very comfortable and clean, the staff members were polite, and the continental+ breakfast was better than expected.
reviews.title: Great motel at a very affordable price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: I have stayed at this motel several times over the years, and it has always been a good, solid choice. We stayed there again over Thanksgiving weekend, and again, it was very good. It is an older motel, as others have mentioned, but they do a pretty good job of keeping it maintained and updated. Our group had 3 rooms, all of which were clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: A good, solid choice for budget lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Being a holiday weekend, the motel was completely full, and the staff seemed a little stressed, but they still did a good job. Grass Valley is a small town, so I don't think they are used to dealing with a high volume of guests.
reviews.title: Noisy-ish, Unreliable WiFi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Because of the holiday weekend, we ended up reserving 2 smoking rooms and 1 non-smoking room because that was all that was available. I called several times leading up to our stay to check on cancellations for non-smoking rooms. The staff was always very gracious on the phone, but there weren't any N/S rooms to be had. Then when we arrived, they had an additional non-smoking room set aside for us. A last-minute cancelation had come in, and one of the front desk staff snagged it for us. I really appreciated that. We still had 1 smoking room, but even that wasn't bad - you could tell it was a smoking room, but clearly they do a nice job of cleaning the rooms, so the lingering cigarette smell wasn't overpowering.
reviews.title: Great Inexpensive Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: External facing doors. You wouldn't know from outside, but on the second floor, everytime someone walks past your door, the entire inner room shakes- you can feel it in the bed, even. Walls are thin. Only reason I slept was because the other guests were relatively quiet. The wifi was very unreliable- even if you could get on, you wouldn't stay on for more than a few minutes and it was very slow. Front desk said internet co and manager hadn't given them any ETA on fix. Fans in bathroom were annoying sounding. Hot water for bath very very slow (probably 15 minutes to fill tub), tub angle too steep to be comfortable for neck- one of those) but ok for showering. Otherwise, good stuff- good bed. Right next to a highway patrol station, so probably safer than average. But I've stayed in better places for about the same price.
reviews.title: Good experience in Grass Valley Ca

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here recently due to a wedding that we attended in Grass Valley. We booked through the hotel's website with a AAA discount. In all, we paid $188.00 for two nights. We really enjoyed our stay. Although the hotel does appear to be a little out dated. It was clean, quiet, and most importantly, the beds were comfortable. My husband and I enjoyed the breakfast on both mornings. It was better than a continental breakfast. They served eggs, bacon, different breads such as muffins, toast, bagels, different juices, coffee, hot chocolate,yogurt, fruit, hard boiled eggs, etc. Everything was fresh and delicious. I was very satisfied with the breakfast and happy that I didn't have to spend money elsewhere for it. So if you are budget conscious like me yet not willing to compromise on service, this is the place for you!
reviews.title: One of my Favorite Best Westerns

description: Welcome to BEST WESTERN Gold Country Inn!Discover this pet friendly Grass Valley, California hotel offering convenient access to Empire Mine State Park, Historic Nevada City and the Tahoe National Forest. Located in northern, inland California just off highway 49, the BEST WESTERN Gold Country Inn is committed to providing the best in customer service, accommodations and amenities at the right price. Each well-appointed guest room at this Grass Valley hotel features cable satellite television and free high-speed Internet access. Hotel guests are welcome to a complimentary full breakfast daily. This pet friendly hotel also offers guest laundry, an exercise facility and a full-service business center. Guests staying at the BEST WESTERN Gold Country Inn will be a short walk from a variety of dining and shopping in historic Grass Valley. The Empire Mine State Park, only two miles away, offer the perfect setting for hiking and afternoon picnics. This California hotel is also less than five miles from many other key area attractions including the Nevada County Fairgrounds, the South Yuba River, Scotts Flat Lake, Bridgeport Historic State Park and Historic Nevada City. Business travelers will appreciate being close to the Whispering Pines Business Park, the Grass Valley Group and the Loma Rica Industrial Park. The Grass Valley area is also home to a variety of annual events including the Draft Horse Classic, Music in the Mountains, Dog Shows, the Teddy Bear Convention and more!The friendly, helpful staff at the BEST WESTERN Gold Country Inn is ready to ensure a fun-filled memorable stay in Grass Valley, California. Make a reservation today and save!**Hot tub and Pool closed until further notice*
